Ursus ente the arena. Struck almost blind by the rays of the sun, he squints and looks around. He is half naked and devoid of weapon. He kneels down and bows his head as if in prayer. freezes in that position. The crowd begins to murmur, the scream.  74.
The left gate opens and an enormous German bull runs out. has a half naked girl tied to its back. With chapped lips pale Vinicius whispers
God, I trust in you. He closes his eyes and mouths a silent prayer. Ursus sees Lygia hanging limply across the bullвЂ™s back. charges towards the bull and extends his hands.
(savage war cry) Ruuaaaaah! The bull rears its powerful head, its horns ripping Ursus left side. Blood pours from the wound.
(a warriorsвЂ™ shout of pain) Urraah! Ursus falls to the ground as the crowd roars and the bull runs around the arena.
Get him! Get him! Kill the giant! Bleed him like a bull! The injured Ursus struggles to get up. He sizes up the be and then lunges at it, grabbing it by the horns.

(warriorвЂ™s savage grunt and cry) Uuurrrrrrrah! The bull starts shaking its head. Ursus tightens his muscles around the bullвЂ™s neck. The animal pushes back. Ursus plants his feet in the ground, halting the beastвЂ™s advance and they remain momentarily frozen. A murmur of admiration rises from the crowd. Ursus begins to twist the bulls head. Straining his muscl to their limit, he throws the beast to the ground. The animalвЂ™s head, held in the giantвЂ™s vise-like grip, be tilt downward. The beast lets out a roar as it begins to foam at the mouth.  75. A moment later, Ursus twists the bullвЂ™s head into an unnatural position. Roaring, it falls to the sand, kickin with its hooves. Ursus kneels over the fallen beast, take hold of Lygia and lifts her up. The arena goes crazy.

Giant! Giant! Giant! Giant! Ursus holds her body up as he moves towards the imperial terrace. The air is filled with the sound of thousands of screamin spectators. Ursus kneels, holding up Lygia, extending her towards Caesar.
Giant! Giant! Giant! Giant!
Imperial terrace. Nero looks down, squinting. Clearly ups he throws down his monocle. He looks around. The crowd chants.

Mercy! Mercy! Mercy! Free them! Free them! Free them! Mercy! Mercy! Free them! Free them! Mercy! Mercy! Set them free! From all sides thumbs go up - a sign of mercy. The whole arena is a forest of raised thumbs. Nero does not want to accept their decision. He is furiou He looks to Poppea, Faon and the others for support. However, everyone is showing the thumbs up. Nero directs gaze at Tigellinus. The pressure of the chanting crowd is enormous.

Arsonist! Murderer! Tyrant! Mother Killer! Despot! Redbeard! Down with Caesar! Nero the murderous dog! Down with tyranny! Tigellinus gazes at the crowd. In the end, he too reluctantly raises his thumb. Suddenly, the crowd once ag starts shouting malevolently at Caesar. Nero still has yet to deliver his judgment. He keeps look for at least one thumb turned down to support his decisio  76. He looks at Petronius. They stare at each other for a whi First, second, third look. And suddenly Petronius raises hand and then holding this position, without taking his e off Nero, he changes direction and shows a thumbs down. It is just as Petronius expected. Nero despises his forme friend, seeing in him the antithesis of everything he hat in his own life. He cannot bear the thought of acting lik Petronius. CaesarвЂ™s thumb slowly drifts upwards. A look of relief passes over PetroniusвЂ™s face.

head_text.subj: SCENE 90 DAY_INT_CIRCUS_DARK CORRIDOR TO THE STREET VIEW

text: Ursus walks down the corridor leading from the arena towa the light coming into the Circus from the street. Vinicius stands in the sunвЂ™s rays, on the other side of bars. The guard opens the gates of the Circus and Ursus takes a step towards freedom. He gives Vinicius the body of the unconscious Lygia. Vinicius turns round, carrying his beloved away towards a new life, away from the Circus, away from Rome.

The morning light penetrates to the library. Petronius le on EuniceвЂ™s arm. They sit in the library, next to the window, overlooking the garden, huddled in a beam of sunlight, staring into the distance, motionless. The centurion Hasto stands at the door behind them. Even does not want to disturb this peace and waits a moment before speaking up.

On CaesarвЂ™s orders, Petronius, I bring you death sentence. The camera zooms out from the centurionвЂ™s face and cont as Petronius and Eunice enter the frame, leaning against each other, their heads touching. When we finally see their faces, they are frozen in a smi but devoid of life. Their eyes are closed.  77. Off screen can be heard a whispered conversation, but the camera still continues to move backwards. In addition, go upwards - slowly like a balloon, like a soul escaping the body.
Do you think Vinicius and Lygia have reached Sicily by now?
Oh, yes. Surely. They were carried on the wings of love.
ItвЂ™s time we also took a journey.
Finally, Master, IвЂ™1l have you at my side, forever.
ItвЂ™s a pity you do not wish to stay. In my testament I left you all my property.

Where we are going now, we wonвЂ™t lack anything! The camera goes on, floating, leaving the bodies of the people below and flows over the Petronius Palace gardens. Suddenly, there is a white pigeon taking flight. The came follows him.

The camera continues to float, following the pigeon. Camera soared for bird so high that suddenly found itself among the clouds. Dairy light completely overlighted the view. When the camera broke through the clouds, you can see the landscape, which is filled to the horizon with a_ waterli or mirrors, or clouds. How aviator loses the consciousness of his position, so w do not know at first that we see only a reflection of a bird. The camera follows the pigeon as in a dream, farther and farther.  78. After a moment, the prospect of full of light, glare and seductive color shows its unreal, heavenly meaning.

If I speak in the tongues of men or of angels, but do not have love, I am only a resounding gong or a clanging cymbal. If I have the gift of prophecy and can fathom all mysteries and all knowledge, and if I have a faith that can move mountains, but do not have love, I am nothing. If I give all I possess to the poor and give over my body to hardship that I may boast,but do not have love, I gain nothing. Love is patient, love is kind. It does not envy, it does not boast, it is not proud. It does not dishonor others, it is not self-seeking, it is not easily angered, it keeps no record of wrongs. Love does not delight in evil but rejoices with the truth. It always protects, always trusts, always hopes, always perseveres. Thus faith, hope and love - these three endure: but the greatest of these is love.
